result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah M Sloop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by calling by the close of business Monday. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations. 
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.

Def to have NO Contact w/ The Smoke Shop, Ashland WI
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
Upon successful completion of conditions of this sentence, this case record will be expunged per Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Isaiah M Sloop appeared by video in custody from Juvenile Detention Center.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Isaiah M Sloop.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Parties have an agreement.  State has complied with victim rights, no request for restitution.  Def understands charges and potential penalties.  Atty, def PLEADS NO CONTEST, def agrees.  Def waives right to personal appearance, discussed with Atty.  Def and Atty placed in break out room.  Back on the record at 9:41.  File contains PLQ.  Def understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaint, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  State is willing to stipulate to credit, court accepts states stipulation.  See attached for sentencing.  Under the age of 25 at time of offenses, if successfully completes sentences and no violations case can be expunged.  State moving to seal Offer to Settle because it contains juvenile information, court is asking state to file a redacted copy.
The original document was titled: Offer to Settle
The original history event date is: 09-29-2022
Email sent to detention center advising def has court on Oct 7;  ka
